Table.Name: action.Action
Table.Description: Encapsulates a NetSuite record action.

Table.Name: Plain JavaScript Object
Table.Description: A plain JavaScript object of actions available for a record type.

Table.Name: action.execute(options)
Table.Description: Executes the record action and returns action results in an object.

Table.Name: action.execute.promise(options)
Table.Description: Asynchronously executes the record action and returns the action results in an object.

Table.Name: action.executeBulk(options)
Table.Description: Executes an asynchronous bulk record action and returns its task ID for later status inquiry.

Table.Name: action.find(options)
Table.Description: Returns a plain JavaScript object of available record actions for the given record type.

Table.Name: action.find.promise(options)
Table.Description: Asynchronously returns a plain JavaScript object of available record actions for the given record type.

Table.Name: action.get(options)
Table.Description: Returns an executable record action for the given record type.

Table.Name: action.get.promise(options)
Table.Description: Asynchronously returns an executable record action for the given record type.

Table.Name: cache.Cache
Table.Description: Encapsulates a cache which is a segment of memory that can be used to store data on a temporary, short-term basis.

Table.Name: cache.getCache(options)
Table.Description: Checks for a cache object with the specified name. If the cache object exists, this method returns it. If the cache object does not exist, the system creates and returns a new cache object.

Table.Name: cache.Scope
Table.Description: Holds the string values that describe the availability of the cache. Use this enum to set the value of the Cache.scope property and the options.scope parameter of the cache.getCache(options) method.

Table.Name: cache.Cache
Table.Description: Encapsulates a cache which is a segment of memory that can be used to store data on a temporary, short-term basis.

Table.Name: cache.getCache(options)
Table.Description: Checks for a cache object with the specified name. If the cache object exists, this method returns it. If the cache object does not exist, the system creates and returns a new cache object.

Table.Name: cache.Scope
Table.Description: Holds the string values that describe the availability of the cache. Use this enum to set the value of the Cache.scope property and the options.scope parameter of the cache.getCache(options) method.

Table.Name: certificateControl.Certificate
Table.Description: Encapsulates a digital certificate record.

Table.Name: certificateControl.findCertificates(options)
Table.Description: Returns metadata about the certificate(s).

Table.Name: certificateControl.findUsages(options)
Table.Description: Returns an audit trail of how a certificate has been used. Includes operations performed with time stamps.

Table.Name: certificateControl.createCertificate(options)
Table.Description: Creates a certificate record using a file from the File Cabinet. After saving with Certificate.save(), the certificate is accessible on the Certificates.

Table.Name: certificateControl.deleteCertificate(options)
Table.Description: Deletes a certificate record that has been uploaded to the Certificates list in the UI or created using certificateControl.createCertificate(options) and saved with Certificate.save().

Table.Name: certificateControl.loadCertificate(options)
Table.Description: Loads a certificate record that has been uploaded to the Certificates list in the UI or created using certificateControl.createCertificate(options).

Table.Name: certificateControl.lock(options)
Table.Description: Locks a certificate record so that it cannot be edited.

Table.Name: certificateControl.unlock(options)
Table.Description: Unlocks a certificate record that has been locked with certificateControl.lock(options).

Table.Name: certificateControl.Operation
Table.Description: Holds the values for the operation when searching for certificates with certificateControl.findUsages(options).

Table.Name: certificateControl.Operator
Table.Description: Holds the values for search operators to use with the name and description parameters of the certificateControl.findCertificates(options) method.

Table.Name: certificateControl.Type
Table.Description: Holds the values for the certificate file type to use with the type parameter of the certificateControl.findCertificates(options) method.

Table.Name: Certificate.save()
Table.Return Type / Value Type: object containing the script ID of the new certificate record
Table.Description: Saves a certificate record.

Table.Name: Certificate.description
Table.Description: Describes the certificate record.

Table.Name: Certificate.file
Table.Description: Includes the properties of the file uploaded to create the certificate.

Table.Name: Certificate.name
Table.Description: The name of the certificate record.

Table.Name: Certificate.monthReminder
Table.Description: The setting of the Month box for Expiration Reminders on the certificate record.

Table.Name: Certificate.notifications
Table.Description: The internal IDs of the employees selected in the Copy Employees field on the certificate record.

Table.Name: Certificate.password
Table.Description: The password for the digital certificate. You can create a GUID for the password using Form.addSecretKeyField(options) or you can create an API secret for the secret at Setup > Company > API Secrets.

Table.Name: Certificate.restrictions
Table.Description: The internal IDs of the employees selected in the Restrict to Employees field of the certificate record.

Table.Name: Certificate.scriptId
Table.Description: The ID of the certificate record.

Table.Name: Certificate.subsidiaries
Table.Description: The internal IDs of the subsidiaries associated with the certificate record.

Table.Name: Certificate.threeMonthsReminder
Table.Description: Indicates the setting of the 3 Months box for Expiration Reminders on the certificate record.

Table.Name: Certificate.weekReminder
Table.Description: Indicates the setting of the Week box for Expiration Reminders on the certificate record.

Table.Name: compress.Archiver
Table.Description:
The functionality for creating archive files.
                    Use compress.createArchiver() to create this object.

Table.Name: compress.createArchiver()
Table.Description: Creates a compress.Archiver object.

Table.Name: compress.gunzip(options)
Table.Description: Decompresses a file and returns it as a temporary file object.

Table.Name: compress.gzip(options)
Table.Description: Compresses a file and returns it as a temporary file object.

Table.Name: compress.Type
Table.Description:
Holds the string values for the archive types.
                    Use this enum to set the value of the type parameter of the method Archiver.archive(options).

Table.Name: Archiver.add(options)
Table.Description: Adds a file to be archived.

Table.Name: Archiver.archive(options)
Table.Description: Creates an archive with the added files and returns it as a temporary file object.

Table.Name: config.load(options)
Table.Description: Loads a record.Record object that encapsulates the specified configuration page.

Table.Name: config.Type
Table.Description: Holds the string values for supported configuration objects. Use this enum to set the value of the NetSuite configuration page you want to access in the config.load(options) method.

Table.Name: certificate.SignedXml
Table.Description:
Encapsulates an XML string that has been digitally signed.
                    Use certificate.signXml(options) to create this object.

Table.Name: certificate.Signer
Table.Description:
Encapsulates a created signature (signer) for plain strings.
                    Use certificate.createSigner(options) to create this object.

Table.Name: certificate.Verifier
Table.Description:
Encapsulates a created verifier for verifying plain string signatures.
                    Use certificate.createVerifier(options) to create this object.

Table.Name: certificate.createSigner(options)
Table.Description: Creates a certificate.Signer object for signing plain strings.

Table.Name: certificate.createVerifier(options)
Table.Description: Creates a certificate.Verifier object for verifying signatures of plain strings.

Table.Name: certificate.signXml(options)
Table.Description:
Signs the input XML string using the Certificate ID. Returns the certificate.SignedXml as a string.
                    
                      Note: 
                      Formatting, such as line breaks, is disabled in signatures.

Table.Name: certificate.verifyXmlSignature(options)
Table.Description: Verifies the signature in the SignedXml.asFile() file.

Table.Name: certificate.HashAlg
Table.Description:
Holds the string values for hash algorithm types.
                    Use this enum to set the option.algorithm property values for the certificate.createSigner(options), certificate.createVerifier(options), certificate.signXml(options) methods.

Table.Name: SignedXml.asFile()
Table.Description: Returns the signed XML as a file object.

Table.Name: SignedXml.asString()
Table.Description: Returns the signed XML as a string.

Table.Name: SignedXml.asXml()
Table.Description: Returns the signed XML as an XML document. You can use the N/xml Module with this document to access elements and attributes in the XML.

Table.Name: Signer.sign(options)
Table.Description: Signs the string and returns the signature.

Table.Name: Signer.update(options)
Table.Description: Updates the input string to be signed. The string can be encoded.

Table.Name: Verifier.update(options)
Table.Description: Updates the string to be verified against specified certificate.

Table.Name: Verifier.verify(options)
Table.Description: Verifies the string against a provided signature using specified certificate.

Table.Name: random.generateBytes(options)
Table.Description: Generates cryptographically strong pseudorandom set of bytes.

Table.Name: random.generateInt(options)
Table.Description: Method used to generate cryptographically strong pseudorandom number.

Table.Name: random.generateUUID()
Table.Description: Method used to generate a v4 Universally Unique Identifier using a cryptographically secure random number generator.

Table.Name: currency.exchangeRate(options)
Table.Description: Returns an exchange rate between two currencies.

Table.Name: dataset.Column
Table.Description: A column in the dataset, which usually represents a record field.

Table.Name: dataset.Condition
Table.Description: A condition or set of conditions to apply to a column.

Table.Name: dataset.Dataset
Table.Description: A representation of the entire dataset, including columns, conditions, and joins.

Table.Name: dataset.Join
Table.Description: A joined record used in the dataset.

Table.Name: dataset.create(options)
Table.Description: Creates a dataset.

Table.Name: dataset.createColumn(options)
Table.Description: Creates a dataset column.

Table.Name: dataset.createCondition(options)
Table.Description: Creates a dataset condition (criteria). A condition is applied to a dataset column and includes an operator.

Table.Name: dataset.createJoin(options)
Table.Description: Creates a dataset join.

Table.Name: dataset.createTranslation(options)
Table.Description: Creates a translation expression based on a Translation Collection.

Table.Name: dataset.describe(options)
Table.Description: Retrieves descriptive information about a dataset, including name, description, and a list of columns or formulas with their labels and types.

Table.Name: dataset.describe.promise(options)
Table.Description: Asynchronously retrieves descriptive information about a dataset, including name, description, and a list of columns or formulas with their labels and types..

Table.Name: dataset.list()
Table.Description: Lists all existing datasets.

Table.Name: dataset.listPaged(options)
Table.Description: Returns metadata about datasets as a set of paged results.

Table.Name: dataset.loadDataset(options)
Table.Description: Loads an existing dataset.

Table.Name: dataset.loadDataset.promise(options)
Table.Description: Asynchronously loads an existing dataset.

Table.Name: Column.alias
Table.Description: The alias of the column.

Table.Name: Column.fieldId
Table.Description: The ID of the record field associated with the column.

Table.Name: Column.formula
Table.Description: The formula of the column.

Table.Name: Column.id
Table.Description: The ID of the column.

Table.Name: Column.join
Table.Description: The join for the column. Used only when the column is from a joined record.

Table.Name: Column.label
Table.Description: The label of the column.

Table.Name: Column.type
Table.Description: The return type of the formula.

Table.Name: Condition.caseSensitive
Table.Description: Indicates whether the condition in a sort is case sensitive.

Table.Name: Condition.children
Table.Description: The children of the condition (for example, subconditions ANDd or ORd).

Table.Name: Condition.column
Table.Description: The column on which the condition is placed.

Table.Name: Condition.operator
Table.Description: The operator of the condition.

Table.Name: Condition.values
Table.Description: The values for the condition.

Table.Name: Dataset.getExpressionFromColumn(options)
Table.Description: Returns an expression which can be used in a workbook.

Table.Name: Dataset.run()
Table.Description: Executes the dataset and returns the result set (the same as in N/query Module).

Table.Name: Dataset.run.promise()
Table.Description: Asynchronously executes the dataset and returns the result set (the same as in N/query Module).

Table.Name: Dataset.runPaged(options)
Table.Description: Executes the dataset and returns the result set in paginated data form (the same as in N/query Module).

Table.Name: Dataset.save(options)
Table.Description: Saves a dataset.

Table.Name: Dataset.columns
Table.Description: The columns in the dataset.

Table.Name: Dataset.condition
Table.Description: The condition (criteria) for the entire dataset.

Table.Name: Dataset.description
Table.Description: The description of the dataset.

Table.Name: Dataset.id
Table.Description: The ID of the dataset.

Table.Name: Dataset.name
Table.Description: The name of the dataset.

Table.Name: Dataset.type
Table.Description: The internal ID for the base record type for the dataset.

Table.Name: Join.fieldId
Table.Description: The ID of the field on which the join is performed.

Table.Name: Join.join
Table.Description: The child join, if the join is a multilevel join.

Table.Name: email.send(options)
Table.Description:
Sends transactional email to an individual or group of recipients and receives bounceback notifications.
                  
                    Note: 
                    To send email on another users behalf, the user triggering the email send must have a role with the Vicarious Email (ADMI_VICARIOUS_EMAIL) permission. If a user without this permission executes SuiteScript that sends email, a Permission Violation error is returned.

Table.Name: email.send.promise(options)
Table.Description: Sends transactional email asynchronously to an individual or group of recipients and receives bounceback notifications.

Table.Name: email.sendBulk(options)
Table.Description: Sends bulk email (for use when a bounceback notification is not required).

Table.Name: email.sendBulk.promise(options)
Table.Description: Sends bulk email asynchronously (for use when a bounceback notification is not required).

Table.Name: email.sendCampaignEvent(options)
Table.Description: Sends a single on-demand campaign email to a specified recipient and return a campaign response ID.

Table.Name: email.sendCampaignEvent.promise(options)
Table.Description: Sends a single on-demand campaign email asynchronously to a specified recipient and return a campaign response ID.

Table.Description: Creates a document to be used as source content when calling the LLM.

Table.Description: Returns the embeddings from the LLM for a given input.

Table.Name: llm.embed.promise(options)
Table.Description: Asynchronously returns the embeddings from the LLM for a given input.

Table.Name: llm.evaluatePrompt(options)
Table.Description: Takes the ID of an existing prompt and values for variables used in the prompt and returns the response from the LLM. When unlimited usage mode is used, it also accepts the OCI configuration parameters.

Table.Name: llm.evaluatePrompt.promise(options)
Table.Description: Takes the ID of an existing prompt and values for variables used in the prompt and asynchronously returns the response from the LLM. When unlimited usage mode is used, it also accepts the OCI configuration parameters.

Table.Name: llm.evaluatePromptStreamed(options)
Table.Description: Takes the ID of an existing prompt and values for variables used in the prompt and returns the streamed response from the LLM. When unlimited usage mode is used, it also accepts the OCI configuration parameters.

Table.Name: llm.evaluatePromptStreamed.promise(options)
Table.Description: Takes the ID of an existing prompt and values for variables used in the prompt and asynchronously returns the streamed response from the LLM. When unlimited usage mode is used, it also accepts the OCI configuration parameters.

Table.Name: llm.generateText(options)
Table.Description: Takes a prompt and parameters for the LLM and returns the response from the LLM. When unlimited usage mode is used, it also accepts the OCI configuration parameters.

Table.Name: llm.generateText.promise(options)
Table.Description: Takes a prompt and parameters for the LLM and asynchronously returns the response from the LLM. When unlimited usage mode is used, it also accepts the OCI configuration parameters.

Table.Name: llm.generateTextStreamed(options)
Table.Description: Takes a prompt and parameters for the LLM and returns the streamed response from the LLM. When unlimited usage mode is used, it also accepts the OCI configuration parameters.

Table.Name: llm.generateTextStreamed.promise(options)
Table.Description: Takes a prompt and parameters for the LLM and asynchronously returns the streamed response from the LLM. When unlimited usage mode is used, it also accepts the OCI configuration parameters.

Use Debug to show all messages.

Use Audit to shows a record of events that have occurred during the processing of the script (for example, A request was made to an external site.).
Use Error to show only unexpected script errors.
Use Emergency to show only the most critical errors in the script log.

Table.Name: query.Column
Table.Description:
The field types (query result columns) that are displayed from the query results.
                    Use Query.createColumn(options) or Component.createColumn(options) to create this object.

Table.Name: query.Component
Table.Description:
One component of the query definition. The query definition always contains at least one component that encapsulates the initial query type. Queries with joins contain multiple components that encapsulate the join relationships.
                    The initial component (Query.root) is automatically created with the query definition (query.Query). Use Query.autoJoin(options) or Component.autoJoin(options) to create subsequent components.

Table.Name: query.Condition
Table.Description:
A condition. A condition narrows the query results.
                    Use Query.createCondition(options) or Component.createCondition(options) to create this object.

Table.Name: query.Page
Table.Description: One page of the paged query results.

Table.Name: query.PagedData
Table.Description: A set of paged query results. This object also contains information about the set of paged results it encapsulates.

Table.Name: query.PageRange
Table.Description: A range of pages from the paged query results.

Table.Name: query.Period
Table.Description: A period of time to use in query conditions.

Table.Name: query.RelativeDate
Table.Description: A relative date to use in query conditions.

Table.Name: query.Result
Table.Description: A single row of the query result set.

Table.Name: query.ResultSet
Table.Description: The set of results returned by the query.

Table.Name: query.Query
Table.Description:
The query definition. Use query.create(options) or query.load(options) to create this object.
                    The creation of this object is the first step in creating a query with the N/query Module.

Table.Name: query.Sort
Table.Description:
A sort that is placed on a particular query result column.
                    Use Query.createSort(options) or Component.createSort(options) to create this object.

Table.Name: query.SuiteQL
Table.Description:
A SuiteQL query.
                    Use Query.toSuiteQL() to create this object.

Table.Name: query.create(options)
Table.Description:
Creates the query definition.
                    The of this method is the first step in creating a query with the N/query Module.

Table.Name: query.createPeriod(options)
Table.Description: Creates a query.Period object that represents a period of time.

Table.Name: query.createRelativeDate(options)
Table.Description: Creates a query.RelativeDate object that represents a date relative to the current date.

Table.Name: query.delete(options)
Table.Description: Deletes an existing query that was created using the SuiteAnalytics Workbook UI. The deleted query is no longer available and cannot be modified or executed.

Table.Name: query.listTables(options)
Table.Description: Lists the table view objects that are included in a workbook in SuiteAnalytics Workbook.

Table.Name: query.load(options)
Table.Description: Loads an existing query that was created using the SuiteAnalytics Workbook UI. The loaded query can be modified (for example, by setting additional property values), joined with other query types, and executed in the same way as queries created using query.create(options).

Table.Name: query.load.promise(options)
Table.Description: Asynchronously loads an existing query that was created using the SuiteAnalytics Workbook UI.

Table.Name: query.runSuiteQL(options)
Table.Description: Runs an arbitrary SuiteQL query.

Table.Name: query.runSuiteQL.promise(options)
Table.Description: Asynchronously runs an arbitrary SuiteQL query.

Table.Name: query.runSuiteQLPaged(options)
Table.Description: Runs an arbitrary SuiteQL query as a paged query.

Table.Name: query.runSuiteQLPaged.promise(options)
Table.Description: Asynchronously runs an arbitrary query as a paged query.

Table.Name: query.Aggregate
Table.Description:
Holds the string values for aggregate functions supported with the N/query Module.
                    This enum is used to pass the aggregate function argument to Component.createColumn(options), Component.createCondition(options), Query.createColumn(options), and Query.createCondition(options).

Table.Name: query.DateId
Table.Description:
Holds the string values for supported date codes in relative dates.
                    This enum is used to pass the date ID argument to query.createRelativeDate(options).

Table.Name: query.FieldContext
Table.Description:
Holds the string values for the field context to use when creating a column.
                    This enum is used to pass the context argument to Query.createColumn(options) and Component.createColumn(options).

Table.Name: query.Operator
Table.Description:
Holds the string values for operators supported with the N/query Module.
                    This enum is used to pass the operator argument to Query.createCondition(options) and Component.createCondition(options).

Table.Name: query.PeriodAdjustment
Table.Description:
Holds the string values for adjustment types for a period.
                    This enum is used to pass the adjustment argument to query.createPeriod(options).

Table.Name: query.PeriodCode
Table.Description:
Holds the string values for period codes for a period.
                    This enum is used to pass the code argument to query.createPeriod(options).

Table.Name: query.PeriodType
Table.Description:
Holds the string values for period types for a period.
                    This enum is used to pass the type argument to query.createPeriod(options).

Table.Name: query.RelativeDateRange
Table.Description:
Holds query.RelativeDate object values for supported date ranges in relative dates.
                    This enum is used to pass the values argument to Query.createCondition(options) and Component.createCondition(options).

Table.Name: query.ReturnType
Table.Description:
Holds the string values for the formula return types supported with the N/query Module.
                    This enum is used to pass the formula return type argument to Query.createColumn(options), Component.createColumn(options), Query.createCondition(options), and Component.createCondition(options).

Table.Name: query.SortLocale
Table.Description:
Holds the string values for sort locales supported with the N/query Module.
                    This enum is used to pass the sort locale argument to Query.createSort(options) and Component.createSort(options).

Table.Name: query.Type
Table.Description:
Holds the string values for supported query types used in the query definition.
                    This enum is used to pass the initial query type argument to query.create(options).

Table.Name: Column.aggregate
Table.Description: An aggregate function that is performed on the query result column. An aggregate function performs a calculation on the column values and returns a single value.

Table.Name: Column.alias
Table.Description: An alias for this column. An alias is an alternate name for a column, and the alias is used in mapped results.

Table.Name: Column.component
Table.Description: A reference to the query.Component object to which this query result column belongs.

Table.Name: Column.context
Table.Description: The field context for values in the query result column. The field context determines how field values are displayed in the column.

Table.Name: Column.fieldId
Table.Description: The name of the query result column. This property and the Column.formula property cannot be set at the same time.

Table.Name: Column.formula
Table.Description: The formula used to create the query result column. This property and the Column.fieldId property cannot be set at the same time.

Table.Name: Column.groupBy
Table.Description: Whether the query results are grouped by this query result column.

Table.Name: Column.label
Table.Description: The label for the column.

Table.Name: Column.type
Table.Description: The return type of the formula used to create the query result column.

Table.Name: Component.autoJoin(options)
Table.Description:
Creates a join relationship.
                    After you create the initial query definition, use Query.autoJoin(options) to create your first join. Then use this method to create each subsequent join.
                    This method selects the correct join type automatically based on the record types that are being joined.

Table.Name: Component.createColumn(options)
Table.Description:
Creates a query result column based on the component.
                    Use this method to create columns based on the join relationships created with Query.autoJoin(options) and Component.autoJoin(options).

Table.Name: Component.createCondition(options)
Table.Description:
Creates a condition (filter column) based on the component.
                    Use this method to create conditions based on the join relationships created with Query.autoJoin(options) and Component.autoJoin(options).

Table.Name: Component.createSort(options)
Table.Description:
Creates a sort based on the component.
                    Use this method to create sorts based on the join relationships created with Query.autoJoin(options) and Component.autoJoin(options).

Table.Name: Component.join(options)
Table.Description:
Creates a join relationship. This method is an alias to Component.autoJoin(options).
                    After you create the initial query definition, use Query.autoJoin(options) to create your first join. Then use this method, or Component.autoJoin(options), to create each subsequent join.

Table.Name: Component.joinFrom(options)
Table.Description:
Creates an explicit directional join relationship from another component to this component (an inverse join). This method sets the Component.source property on the returned query.Component object.
                    After you create the initial query definition, use this method to create explicit directional joins from other components to this component.

Table.Name: Component.joinTo(options)
Table.Description:
Creates an explicit directional join relationship to another component from this component (a join). You can use this method to specify the target of the join when a field can join multiple query types. This method sets the Component.target property on the returned query.Component object.
                    After you create the initial query definition, use this method to create explicit directional joins to other components from this component.

Table.Name: Component.child
Table.Description: The child components of the component. This property holds an object of key-value pairs. Each key is the name of a child component. Each value is the corresponding child query.Component object.

Table.Name: Component.parent
Table.Description: The parent query.Component object of the component.

Table.Name: Component.source
Table.Description:
The source query type of the component.
                    The value of this property is set when Component.joinFrom(options) is called to perform an explicit directional join from another component.

Table.Name: Component.target
Table.Description:
The target query type of the component.
                    The value of this property is set when Component.joinTo(options) is called to perform an explicit directional join to another component.

Table.Name: Component.type
Table.Description: The query type of the component.

Table.Name: Condition.aggregate
Table.Description: An aggregate function that is performed on the condition. An aggregate function performs a calculation on the condition values and returns a single value.

Table.Name: Condition.children
Table.Description: An of child conditions used to create the parent condition.

Table.Name: Condition.component
Table.Description: A reference to the query.Component object to which this condition belongs.

Table.Name: Condition.fieldId
Table.Description: The name of the field that is used in the condition.

Table.Name: Condition.formula
Table.Description: The formula used to create the condition.

Table.Name: Condition.operator
Table.Description: The name of the operator used to create the condition.

Table.Name: Condition.type
Table.Description: The return type of the formula used to create the condition.

Table.Name: Condition.values
Table.Description: An of values used by an operator to create the condition.

Table.Name: Page.data
Table.Description: The query results contained in this page.

Table.Name: Page.isFirst
Table.Description: Whether this page is the first of the paged query results.

Table.Name: Page.isLast
Table.Description: Whether this page is the last of the paged query results.

Table.Name: Page.pagedData
Table.Description: The set of paged query results that this page is from.

Table.Name: Page.pageRange
Table.Description: The range of query results for this page.

Table.Name: PagedData.iterator()
Table.Description: Standard SuiteScript 2.0 object for iterating through results.

Table.Name: PagedData.fetch(options)
Table.Description: Retrieves a page in the set of pages included in the PagedData object.

Table.Name: PagedData.fetch.promise(options)
Table.Description: Asynchronously retrieves a page in the set of pages included in the PagedData object.

Table.Name: PagedData.count
Table.Description: The total number of paged query results.

Table.Name: PagedData.pageRanges
Table.Description: An of page ranges for the set of paged query results.

Table.Name: PagedData.pageSize
Table.Description: The number of query result rows per page.

Table.Name: PageRange.index
Table.Description: The index for this page range.

Table.Name: PageRange.size
Table.Description: The number of query result rows in this page range.

Table.Name: Period.adjustment
Table.Description:
The adjustment of the period.
                    This property uses values from the query.PeriodAdjustment enum.

Table.Name: Period.code
Table.Description:
The code of the period.
                    This property uses values from the query.PeriodCode enum.

Table.Name: Period.type
Table.Description:
The type of the period.
                    This property uses values from the query.PeriodType enum.

Table.Name: Query.and(conditions)
Table.Description: Creates a new condition (a query.Condition object) that corresponds to a logical conjunction (AND) of the arguments passed to the method. The arguments must be one or more query.Condition objects.

Table.Name: Query.autoJoin(options)
Table.Description:
Creates a join relationship.
                    After you create the initial query definition, use this method to create your first join or subsequent joins from the root component of the query.
                    This method selects the correct join type automatically based on the record types that are being joined.

Table.Name: Query.createColumn(options)
Table.Description:
Creates a query result column based on the query.Query object.
                    Use this method to create columns on the initial query definition created with query.create(options).

Table.Name: Query.createCondition(options)
Table.Description:
Creates a condition (filter column) based on the query.Query object.
                    Use this method to create conditions on the initial query definition created with query.create(options).

Table.Name: Query.createSort(options)
Table.Description: Creates a sort based on the query.Query object. The query.Sort object describes a sort that is placed on a particular query result column or condition.

Table.Name: Query.join(options)
Table.Description:
Creates a join relationship. This method is an alias to Query.autoJoin(options).
                    After you create the initial query definition, use this method, or Query.autoJoin(options), to create your first join.

Table.Name: Query.joinFrom(options)
Table.Description:
Creates an explicit directional join relationship from another component to the root component of the search definition (an inverse join). This method sets the Component.source property on the returned query.Component object.
                    After you create the initial query definition, use this method to create your first join as an explicit directional join from another component to this component.

Table.Name: Query.joinTo(options)
Table.Description:
Creates an explicit directional join relationship to another component from this component (a forward join). You can use this method to specify the target of the join when a field can join multiple query types. This method sets the Component.target property on the returned query.Component object.
                    After you create the initial query definition, use this method to create your first join as an explicit directional join to another component from this component.

Table.Name: Query.not(condition)
Table.Description: Creates a new condition (a query.Condition object) that corresponds to a logical negation (NOT) of the argument passed to the method. The argument must be a query.Condition object.

Table.Name: Query.or(conditions)
Table.Description: Creates a new condition (a query.Condition object) that corresponds to a logical disjunction (OR) of the arguments passed to the method. The arguments must be one or more query.Condition objects.

Table.Name: Query.run()
Table.Description: Executes the query and returns the query result set.

Table.Name: Query.run.promise()
Table.Description: Executes the query asynchronously and returns the query result set.

Table.Name: Query.runPaged()
Table.Description: Executes the query and returns a set of paged results.

Table.Name: Query.runPaged.promise()
Table.Description: Executes the query asynchronously and returns a set of paged results.

Table.Name: Query.toSuiteQL()
Table.Description: Converts this query.Query object to its corresponding SuiteQL representation.

Table.Name: Query.child
Table.Description: A reference to children of the root component of the query definition. The value of this property is an object of key-value pairs. Each key is the name of a child component. Each respective value is the corresponding query.Component object.

Table.Name: Query.columns
Table.Description:
An of query result columns returned from the query.
                    Before you perform the query, you must assign all created columns as values to this property.

Table.Name: Query.condition
Table.Description:
The parent condition that narrows the query results.
                    Before you perform the query, you must assign your simple or complex conditions to this property.

Table.Name: Query.id
Table.Description:
The ID of the query definition.
                    This property has a value only for existing queries that are loaded using query.load(options). If you create a query using query.create(options) but do not save it, this property is null.

Table.Name: Query.name
Table.Description:
The name of the query definition.
                    This property has a value only for existing queries that are loaded using query.load(options). If you create a query using query.create(options) but do not save it, this property is null.

Table.Name: Query.root
Table.Description: The root component of the query definition.

Table.Name: Query.sort
Table.Description: An of query result columns used for sorting.

Table.Name: Query.type
Table.Description: The query type of the initial query definition.

Table.Name: RelativeDate.dateId
Table.Description: The ID of the relative date.

Table.Name: RelativeDate.end
Table.Description: The end point of the relative date.

Table.Name: RelativeDate.interval
Table.Description: The interval of the relative date (from the RelativeDate.start point to the RelativeDate.end point).

Table.Name: RelativeDate.isRange
Table.Description: Whether the relative date represents a range of dates or a specific moment in time.

Table.Name: RelativeDate.start
Table.Description: The start point of the relative date.

Table.Name: RelativeDate.value
Table.Description: The value of the relative date.

Table.Name: Result.asMap()
Table.Description: The query result as a mapped result.

Table.Name: Result.values
Table.Description: The result values.

Table.Name: ResultSet.asMappedResults()
Table.Description: Returns a query result set as an of mapped results.

Table.Name: ResultSet.iterator()
Table.Description: Standard SuiteScript 2.0 object for iterating through results.

Table.Name: ResultSet.columns
Table.Description: An of query result column references.

Table.Name: ResultSet.results
Table.Description: An of query.Result objects.

Table.Name: ResultSet.types
Table.Description: An of the return types for ResultSet.results.

Table.Name: Sort.ascending
Table.Description: Whether the sort direction is ascending.

Table.Name: Sort.caseSensitive
Table.Description:
Whether the sort is case sensitive.
                    If a sort is case sensitive (and the sort direction is ascending), rows with column values that start with uppercase letters are listed before rows with column values that start with lowercase letters. If a sort is not case sensitive, uppercase and lowercase letters are treated the same.

Table.Name: Sort.column
Table.Description: The query result column that the query results are sorted by.

Table.Name: Sort.locale
Table.Description:
The locale to use for the sort.
                    A locale represents a combination of language and region, and it can affect how certain values (such as strings) are sorted.

Table.Name: Sort.nullsLast
Table.Description: Whether query results with null values are listed at the end of the query results.

Table.Name: SuiteQL.run()
Table.Description: Runs the SuiteQL query and returns the query results.

Table.Name: SuiteQL.runPaged(options)
Table.Description: Runs the SuiteQL query as a paged query and returns the paged query results.

Table.Name: SuiteQL.columns
Table.Description: Describes the result columns to be returned from the query.

Table.Name: SuiteQL.params
Table.Description: Contains the parameters for the query.

Table.Name: SuiteQL.query
Table.Description: Holds the string representation of the query.

Table.Name: SuiteQL.type
Table.Description:
Describes the type of the query.
                    This property uses values from the query.Type enum.

Table.Name: recordContext.RecordContext

Table.Name: recordContext.getContext(options)
Table.Description: Returns the record context object for a record.

Table.Name: recordContext.ContextType
Table.Description: Holds the values for the context type. Used to set the value for the contextTypes parameter of the recordContext.getContext(options) method.

Table.Name: recognition.MergeArrangementsTask
Table.Description:
Encapsulates a task to merge all of the revenue elements from a specified list of revenue arrangements.
                    Use recognition.create(options) to create this object.

Table.Name: recognition.MergeArrangementsTaskStatus
Table.Description:
Encapsulates the current status of a submitted merge task.
                    Use recognition.checkStatus(options) to create this object.

Table.Name: recognition.MergeElementsTask
Table.Description:
Encapsulates a task to merge all of the specified revenue elements.
                    Use recognition.create(options) to create this object.

Table.Name: recognition.checkStatus(options)
Table.Description: Checks the status of a submitted merge task.

Table.Name: recognition.create(options)
Table.Description:
Creates a merge task that combines entire revenue arrangements or individual revenue elements.
                    Use values in the recognition.TaskType enum to specify the type of merge task to create.

Table.Name: recognition.TaskStatus
Table.Description:
Holds the string values for supported merge task statuses.
                    This enum is used to represent the task status in a recognition.MergeArrangementsTaskStatus object.

Table.Name: recognition.TaskType
Table.Description:
Holds the string values for supported merge task types.
                    This enum is used to pass the task type argument to recognition.create(options).

Table.Name: MergeArrangementsTask.submit()
Table.Description:
Submits the merge task for processing.
                    This method returns a task ID that uniquely identifies the merge task.

Table.Name: MergeArrangementsTask.arrangements
Table.Description: Holds an array of internal IDs of the revenue arrangement records to merge.

Table.Name: MergeArrangementsTask.contractAcquisitionDeferredExpenseAccount
Table.Description:
References the contract acquisition deferred expense account for the new revenue arrangement. This property is valid only if the accounting preference Enable Advanced Cost Amortization is enabled. For more information, see Advanced Cost Amortization.
                    The default value is the account specified by the accounting preference Contract Acquisition Deferred Expense Account in your account.

Table.Name: MergeArrangementsTask.contractAcquisitionExpenseAccount
Table.Description:
References the contract acquisition expense account for the new revenue arrangement. This property is valid only if the accounting preference Enable Advanced Cost Amortization is enabled. For more information, see Advanced Cost Amortization.
                    The default value is the account specified by the accounting preference Contract Acquisition Expense Account in your account.

Table.Name: MergeArrangementsTask.contractCostAccrualDate
Table.Description:
Describes the contract cost accrual date to use for the new revenue arrangement. This property is valid only if the accounting preference Enable Advanced Cost Amortization is enabled. For more information, see Advanced Cost Amortization.
                    The default value is todays date.

Table.Name: MergeArrangementsTask.mergeResidualRevenueAmounts
Table.Description:
Indicates whether the revenue arrangements are merged prospectively. For more information about prospective merges, see Prospective Merges.
                    The default value is false.

Table.Name: MergeArrangementsTask.recalculateResidualFairValue
Table.Description:
Indicates whether to recalculate the fair value on residual elements when revenue arrangements are prospectively merged. For more information about prospective merges, see Prospective Merges.
                    This property can be set to true only if the MergeArrangementsTask.mergeResidualRevenueAmounts property is also set to true. The default value is false.

Table.Name: MergeArrangementsTask.revenueArrangementDate
Table.Description:
Describes the date of the new revenue arrangement.
                    The default value is todays date.

Table.Name: MergeArrangementsTaskStatus.errorMessage
Table.Description: Holds an error message that describes the failure of the merge task. This property is valid only if the value of the status property is TaskStatus.FAILED.

Table.Name: MergeArrangementsTaskStatus.inputArrangements
Table.Description: Holds an array of internal IDs of the revenue arrangement records to merge. This property is valid only if the merge task was created using a task type of TaskType.MERGE_ARRANGEMENTS_TASK.

Table.Name: MergeArrangementsTaskStatus.inputElements
Table.Description: Holds an array of internal IDs of the revenue elements to merge. This property is valid only if the merge task was created using a task type of TaskType.MERGE_ELEMENTS_TASK.

Table.Name: MergeArrangementsTaskStatus.resultingArrangement
Table.Description: References the internal ID of the new revenue arrangement that was created. This property is valid only if the value of the status property is TaskStatus.COMPLETE.

Table.Name: MergeArrangementsTaskStatus.status
Table.Description:
Represents the current status of the merge task.
                    This property uses values in the recognition.TaskStatus enum.

Table.Name: MergeArrangementsTaskStatus.submissionId
Table.Description: References the submission ID of the merge arrangements bulk process.

Table.Name: MergeArrangementsTaskStatus.taskId
Table.Description: Holds the task ID of the merge task. The task ID is assigned to the merge task when you call recognition.create(options).

Table.Name: MergeElementsTask.submit()
Table.Description:
Submits the merge task for processing.
                    This method returns a task ID that uniquely identifies the merge task.

Table.Name: MergeElementsTask.contractAcquisitionDeferredExpenseAccount
Table.Description:
References the contract acquisition deferred expense account for the new revenue arrangement. This property is valid only if the accounting preference Enable Advanced Cost Amortization is enabled. For more information, see Advanced Cost Amortization.
                    The default value is the account specified by the accounting preference Contract Acquisition Deferred Expense Account in your account.

Table.Name: MergeElementsTask.contractAcquisitionExpenseAccount
Table.Description:
References the contract acquisition expense account for the new revenue arrangement. This property is valid only if the accounting preference Enable Advanced Cost Amortization is enabled. For more information, see Advanced Cost Amortization.
                    The default value is the account specified by the accounting preference Contract Acquisition Expense Account in your account.

Table.Name: MergeElementsTask.contractCostAccrualDate
Table.Description:
Describes the contract cost accrual date to use for the new revenue arrangement. This property is valid only if the accounting preference Enable Advanced Cost Amortization is enabled. For more information, see Advanced Cost Amortization.
                    The default value is todays date.

Table.Name: MergeElementsTask.elements

Table.Name: MergeElementsTask.revenueArrangementDate

Describes the date of the new revenue arrangement.
                    The default value is todays date.

Table.Name: transaction.void(options)

Table.Name: transaction.void.promise(options)
Table.Description: Voids a transaction record asynchronously.

Table.Name: transaction.Type

Table.Name: translation.Handle
Table.Description: Encapsulates a Translation Collection for a locale.

Table.Name: translation.Translator
Table.Description: Represents a translator function that returns translated strings. The translated strings include variables that are passed as parameters to the translator function.

Table.Name: translation.get(options)
Table.Description: Creates a translator function for a key in the specified Translation Collection and locale.

Table.Name: translation.load(options)
Table.Description: Creates a translation.Handle object with translations for the specified Translation Collections and locales.

Table.Name: translation.selectLocale(options)
Table.Description: Creates a translation.Handle object in the specified locale from an existing translation.Handle object.

Table.Name: translation.Locale
Table.Description:
Holds the supported locales for Translation Collections.

Table.Name: Message.hide()

Table.Name: Message.show(options)
Table.Description: Shows the message.

Table.Name: xml.Attr
Table.Description: Represents an attribute node of an xml.Element object.

Table.Name: xml.Document
Table.Description: Represents an entire XML document. The XML DOM presents a document as a hierarchy of node objects. Use the methods and properties available to the xml.Document object to manipulate the XML document and the nodes in the document tree.

Table.Name: xml.Element
Table.Description: Represents an element in an XML document. Elements may contain attributes, other elements, or text. If an element contains text, the text is represented in a text node of type TEXT_NODE.

Table.Name: xml.Node
Table.Description: Represents a generic XML node in an XML document. A node can be a Document, Element, or Attribute.

Table.Name: xml.Parser
Table.Description: Encapsulates the functionality used by NetSuite to parse XML.

Table.Name: xml.XPath
Table.Description:
Encapsulates the functionality used by NetSuite to run XPath expressions.
                  XPath is a standard for enumerating paths in an XML document collection.

Table.Name: xml.escape(options)
Table.Description: Prepares a string for use in XML by escaping XML markup, such as angle brackets, quotation marks, and ampersands.

Table.Name: xml.validate(options)
Table.Description: Validates an XML document against an XML Schema (XSD).

Table.Description: Holds the string values for the supported node types. Use this enum to set the Node.nodeType property.
